T1016.001::[Gamaredon Group] has tested connectivity between a compromised machine and a C2 server using  [Ping] with commands such as `CSIDL_SYSTEM\cmd.exe /c ping -n 1`.
T1021.005::[Gamaredon Group] has used VNC tools, including UltraVNC, to remotely interact with compromised hosts.
T1027.001::[Gamaredon Group] has obfuscated .NET executables by inserting junk code.
T1027.004::[Gamaredon Group] has compiled the source code for a downloader directly on the infected system using the built-in Microsoft.CSharp.CSharpCodeProvider class.
T1027.010::[Gamaredon Group] has used obfuscated or encrypted scripts.
T1036.005::[Gamaredon Group] has used legitimate process names to hide malware including svchosst.
T1053.005::[Gamaredon Group] has created scheduled tasks to launch executables after a designated number of minutes have passed.
T1059.001::[Gamaredon Group] has used obfuscated PowerShell scripts for staging.
T1059.003::[Gamaredon Group] has used various batch scripts to establish C2 and download additional files. [Gamaredon Group]'s backdoor malware has also been written to a batch file.
T1059.005::[Gamaredon Group] has embedded malicious macros in document templates, which executed VBScript. [Gamaredon Group] has also delivered Microsoft Outlook VBA projects with embedded macros.
T1070.004::[Gamaredon Group] tools can delete files used during an operation.
T1071.001::[Gamaredon Group] has used HTTP and HTTPS for C2 communications.
T1204.002::[Gamaredon Group] has attempted to get users to click on Office attachments with malicious macros embedded.
T1218.005::[Gamaredon Group] has used `mshta.exe` to execute malicious HTA files.
T1218.011::[Gamaredon Group] malware has used rundll32 to launch additional malicious components.
T1491.001::[Gamaredon Group] has left taunting images and messages on the victims' desktops as proof of system access.
T1547.001::[Gamaredon Group] tools have registered Run keys in the registry to give malicious VBS files persistence.
T1559.001::[Gamaredon Group] malware can insert malicious macros into documents using a Microsoft.Office.Interop object.
T1562.001::[Gamaredon Group] has delivered macros which can tamper with Microsoft Office security settings.
T1564.003::[Gamaredon Group] has used hidcon to run batch files in a hidden console window.
T1566.001::[Gamaredon Group] has delivered spearphishing emails with malicious attachments to targets.
T1583.001::[Gamaredon Group] has registered multiple domains to facilitate payload staging and C2.
T1608.001::[Gamaredon Group] has registered domains to stage payloads.
